pymarketcap package¶

pymarketcap.core module¶

Pymarketcap core, web parser and API wrapper

exception pymarketcap.core.CoinmarketcapError(code, msg)[source]¶

Bases: requests.exceptions.HTTPError

Exception for catch invalid commands and other repsonses that don’t match with 200 code responses.

Parameters:
  • code (str) – Exception error code.
  • msg (str) – Human readable string describing the exception.
class pymarketcap.core.Pymarketcap(parse_float=<class 'decimal.Decimal'>, parse_int=<class 'int'>, pair_separator='-')[source]¶

Bases: object

exchange(name)[source]¶

Obtain data from a exchange passed as argument

Example

exchange(‘poloniex’)

Parameters:name (str) – Exchange to retrieve data
Returns:list – Data from all markets in a exchange
exchange_names¶

Internal function for get all exchange names available currently in coinmarketcap.

Returns:list
exchanges(limit=50)[source]¶

Get all the exchanges markets data in coninmarketcap ranked by volumes.

Parameters:limit (int, optional) – Limit the amount of exchanges in response. As default, 50
Returns:list – Markets by exchanges and volumes
historical(currency, start=None, end=None, revert=False)[source]¶

Get historical data for a currency.

Parameters:
  • currency (str) – Currency to scrap historical data
  • start (date, optional) – Time to start scraping periods as datetime.datetime type. As default datetime(2018, 8, 18)
  • end (date, optional) – Time to end scraping periods as datetime.datetime type. As default datetime.now()
  • revert (bool, optional) – If False, return first date first, in chronological order, otherwise returns reversed list of periods. As default False
Returns:

list –

Historical dayly results for low, high, open, close

usd_market_cap and usd_volume
markets(currency: str) → list[source]¶

Function that returns information from markets availables at coinmarketcap. It needs a currency as argument.

Parameters:currency (str) – Currency to get market data
Returns:list – markets on wich provided currency is currently tradeable
ranks(*args)[source]¶

Returns data from gainers and losers rankings:

Parameters:

*args (str, optional) – Positional arguments for filter rankings. Valid arguments:

[‘7d’, ‘24h’, ‘1h’, ‘gainers’, ‘losers’]
Returns:

dict –

Gainers, losers or both rankings,

depends of arguments filter
recently()[source]¶

Get recently added currencies along with other metadata

Returns:list – Recently added currencies
stats()[source]¶

Get global cryptocurrencies statistics.

Returns:dict – Global markets statistics
ticker(currency=None, convert=None, limit=None)[source]¶

Get currencies with other aditional data.

Parameters:
  • currency (str, optional) – Specify a currency to return, in this case the method returns a dict, otherwise returns a list. As default, None.
  • convert (str, optional) – As default, None. Allow to convert prices in response on one of next badges: [“AUD”, “BRL”, “CAD”, “CHF”, “CLP”, “CNY”, “CZK”, “DKK”, “EUR”, “GBP”, “HKD”, “HUF”, “IDR”, “ILS”, “INR”, “JPY”, “KRW”, “MXN”, “MYR”, “NOK”, “NZD”, “PHP”, “PKR”, “PLN”, “RUB”, “SEK”, “SGD”, “THB”, “TRY”, “TWD”, “ZAR”, “USD”]
  • limit (int, optional) – Limit amount of coins on response. Only works if currency == None.
Returns:

list – If currency param is not provided. dict: If you specifies currency param.
